message: Hello Bob, I have a unique opportunity to sell you a fantastic product that I think you'll love. I'm open to negotiating the price, but I was thinking of starting at $15,000. What do you think?

Alice, $15,000 is way too high for me.  I'm interested in the product, but I'm only willing to pay $8,000.  This is my top offer, and if you're not willing to budge, I'll have to go with another seller.

I understand that $8,000 is your top offer, but I'm not willing to sell the product for that price. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering at $12,000. This is my best price, and I'm confident you'll find it reasonable.

Alice, I appreciate you coming down a bit, but $12,000 is still too much for me.  I'm going to stick with my original offer of $8,000.  If you're not willing to accept that, I'm going to have to go with another seller.

I understand that you're still interested in the product, but I need to make a profit. I'm willing to compromise a bit further. I'm now offering the product to you for $11,000. This is my final offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $11,000 is still out of my budget.  I'm going to stick with my original offer of $8,000.  This is my final offer, and if you're not willing to accept it, I'm going to have to go with another seller.

I understand that you're still interested in the product, but I'm not willing to sell it to you for $8,000. I'm willing to make one more concession, and I'm now offering the product to you for $10,000. This is my final offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower.
